content.title: Saphenofemoral Junction
content.definition: The anatomic junction where the great saphenous vein empties into the common femoral vein, a critical landmark for venous surgery and the most common site of saphenous reflux origin.

clinical_features.depth: 4-5cm deep to skin in average patient

concepts.definition: Named veins joining at or near the junction.
The valve at the saphenofemoral junction.

clinical_features.function: Prevents reflux from femoral to saphenous vein

clinical_features.ablation_distance: 2cm from junction recommended for thermal ablation

clinical_features.ultrasound_assessment: Standard start point for saphenous vein mapping
clinical_features.reflux_origin: Most common source of primary varicose veins
